conclusion: To determine the height H at which the fire extinguishing projectile hits the high-rise building, we need to analyze the projectile motion under the given conditions.
We will break down the problem into two parts: the horizontal motion and the vertical motion.
The horizontal component of the initial velocity v_0 is given by: v_{0x} = v_0 cos(θ)
The horizontal distance L covered by the projectile is given by: L = v_{0x} × t
The vertical component of the initial velocity v_0 is given by: v_{0y} = v_0 sin(θ)
The vertical displacement y (which is the height H) can be calculated using the equation of motion for vertical displacement under constant acceleration: y = v_{0y} t - (1/2) g t^2

premise: Substitute the known values: y = 40 m/s × 2 s - (1/2) × 10 m/s² × (2 s)²
Therefore, the height H at which the fire extinguishing projectile hits the high-rise building is: 60 m
